De cauterizacio de plauresi.	"De Cauterization of the Womb." In English, this phrase translates to a historical medical procedure known as dilation and curettage (D&C), which was sometimes used for treating conditions like fibroids or as an abortion method before more modern alternatives were available. De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	Bronchial electrocautery is a medical procedure used to treat various respiratory conditions, such as bronchial lesions or tumors that obstruct the airways. During this intervention, an electrical current is applied through a specialized catheter inserted into the affected bronchus (a part of the lung's airway). The electrocautery device generates heat, which helps to remove abnormal tissue by causing coagulative necrosis and minimizes bleeding.

E adonc yeu cogitegui que eran dels osses del fet mort.	It seems you are referring to a concept related to the bones of the fetal skeleton, which can be described as follows: The fetal skeleton starts off with more flexible and cartilaginous structures rather than fully-formed bone tissue found in adults. As development progresses, these cartilages gradually ossify through a process known as endochondral ossification, where the cartilage is replaced by bone tissue. This transition starts around the 8th week of gestation and continues until about age 25 when most of the growth plates (epiphyseal plates) have fully ossified into epiphyses. Additionally, there are also important transitions such as the fusion of cranial sutures that occurs postnatally to complete the skull formation.

The phrase in Spanish translates to "They are not prolonged stitches so that the bleeding is not prohibited from healing." The second type of suture proper that was invented by John Mayhew is called the "John Mayhew Suture", and it is his own language and recommendation. This technique involves heating half of the silk thread used in medicine, then applying both ends to each other as if they were conveniently matched by nature. The opposite ends are also attached together, and this method ensures that only compatible parts are joined according to need.

Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	Here is the Sermon of Gualia, a popular Catalan proverb that dates back to the Middle Ages. The full text in its original language reads:

E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	Immediately afterwards, he made a reduction in the amount of food in her stomach, since it was then apparent that she had diarrhea.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	If the limb returns as desired after treatment, we will continue administering the same medication and care for any wounds that align with one of their specific discomforts, which may include various types of dry injuries.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	Dislocated or fractured joints separated by stable bones may result in deep lacerations when you penetrate their ligaments, and it is important to note that even simple injuries at these locations can have a preceding history of such damage.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	Watch and avoid according to your virtue the one who causes fear on the road of terror, as I have been preceded by my preaching; for this is better for you from your Creator, and more lasting in your glory, and more beneficial for your true ones in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Ayşe, please speak Portuguese perfectly from the words of Albuquerque so that God is not far away.
Amen.	English: Alright, have a great day!
